history.content:
I think that you will get a similar experience with either over the summer in that both will be a lot of information to learn in a short amount of time. 61C projects vs 70 homework sets seem about the same, but I've only taken during non summer semesters. If you're set on doing a CS requirement this summer you should look at upper divs you want to do that might have 61C vs 70 as prereqs. For example, you'd want to do 70 asap to get started on probability for ML.
If you're LSCS, 70 over the summer gives you less time with the material, so if you need to do well I'd take it during normal semester. I needed to guarantee a good grade in 70 to declare, so I took that as my only technical last semester and it worked out pretty well.

I think that you will get a similar experience with either over the summer, and if you're set on doing a CS requirement this summer you should look at upper divs you want to do that might have 61C vs 70 as prereqs. For example, you'd want to do 70 asap to get started on probability for ML.
If you're LSCS, 70 over the summer gives you less time with the material, but you aren't juggling other harder classes. I needed to guarantee a good grade in 70 to declare, so I took that as my only technical last semester and it worked out pretty well.
I have done 61A and B and want to take either 61C or 70 over the summer? Which one is easier to manage and in which will I be able to get the best understanding of all material?
history.subject: 61C or 70 over the summer?
